page.title: 08ARTISTS IN ST.IVES .
page.content: Since visits, in the late 19th century by painters such as Whistler and Sickert,St.Ives has had an{artists {colony}.Attracted by the light, landscape and atmosphere St.Ives has been both home and inspiration to artists of national and international repute. Today both painters and sculptors work in{figurative}and{abstract styles. Their studios (some one time net-lofts) are mainly in the Porthmeor area. Their work is exhibited in the {Penwith}and{New}galleries, as well as in smaller private galleries. The{Tate}gallery now administers the studio and sculpture garden of Dame Barbera{Hepworth},and the studio pottery of Bernard{Leach}still flourishes. In 1985 the Tate Gallery held an exhibition of St.Ives art.
